metadata.source: Curated from official program websites and VA resources
metadata.description: Emergency financial assistance programs for veterans in crisis - eviction, utility shutoff, medical emergencies

programs.max_amount_notes: Up to $1,500 per grant; paid directly to creditors

eligibility.summary: Service members and veterans who are facing financial hardship due to deployment, military pay errors, medical discharge, or service-connected injuries/illness after 9/11/2001
eligibility.discharge_status: any (no dishonorable discharge required for post-9/11)
eligibility.notes: Financial hardship must be related to military service. Active duty hardship must be due to deployment, pay error, or medical discharge.

programs.application_process: Online application at vfw.org/assistance. All applications individually reviewed. Payments made directly to creditors upon approval.

programs.max_amount_notes: Up to $2,500 one-time grant (increased from $1,500 in May 2025); focused on minor children in the home

eligibility.summary: American Legion members or active-duty service members with minor children (under 18 or under 21 if still in high school) living in the home
eligibility.membership_notes: Legion membership required for veterans; active duty can apply without membership
eligibility.notes: Must have minor children in household. One-time lifetime grant only. Children must be biological, stepchildren, or in legal custody.

programs.application_process: Application originates at local American Legion post. Contact department headquarters for PDF application. Requires home visit by two-party team to validate need.

programs.max_amount_notes: Grant amounts vary based on need; program has distributed over $17 million since 1968

eligibility.summary: Veterans and their surviving spouses affected by natural disasters (hurricanes, tornadoes, floods, fires)
eligibility.notes: Must be impacted by a natural disaster. In 2024, provided nearly $1.5 million to 2,000+ veterans across 24 states.

programs.application_process: Contact local DAV chapter or National Service Officer in disaster-affected area. DAV has teams on the ground during major disasters to assist veterans.
programs.turnaround_time: Immediate to 1 week during active disaster response

programs.max_amount_notes: Amount varies by need; program has fulfilled 60,000+ requests totaling $47+ million since inception

eligibility.summary: Active-duty service members (E1-E6), those on Title 10 orders or receiving hazardous duty pay, and post-9/11 wounded/ill/injured veterans
eligibility.notes: Active duty E1-E6 may receive 3 lifetime assists. Deployed or hazardous duty may receive 3 lifetime assists. Wounded/ill/injured post-9/11 veterans may receive 5 lifetime assists.

programs.application_process: Create account at operationhomefront.org and submit application through online portal. Professional caseworkers validate financial need before providing support. Grants paid directly to service providers or as grocery cards.

programs.program_name: Service Member and Family Support Program
programs.max_amount_notes: Amount varies; organization has delivered $500+ million in grants and services since 2004

eligibility.summary: Combat wounded, critically ill, and catastrophically injured service members and veterans from all branches of the U.S. Armed Forces
eligibility.disability_notes: Must be combat wounded, critically ill, or catastrophically injured
eligibility.notes: Provides one-on-one case management and lifetime support. In FY2025, served nearly 16,000 individuals.

programs.application_process: Apply through thefund.org website. Case managers assigned to provide personalized support throughout recovery process.
programs.turnaround_time: Varies based on need; bedside support available during hospitalization

programs.max_amount_notes: Up to 3 months of delinquent payments; one emergency request per household

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 combat veterans experiencing unexpected short-term (1-3 months) financial setback, with VA disability rating or pending claim
eligibility.disability_notes: Must have VA disability rating or proof of pending VA disability claim
eligibility.notes: Bills must be 30-90 days past due (rent 3-90 days). Foundation has provided $55+ million in financial support.

programs.application_process: Submit through online portal at penfedfoundation.org. Requires VA disability rating statement or proof of claim submission, plus recent bills showing past due status. Payments made directly to creditors.

programs.max_amount_notes: Amount varies based on need; no fees or repayment required

eligibility.summary: Post-9/11 veterans, service members, and military families experiencing financial hardship from service-related incidents or medical issues
eligibility.notes: Requires DD214, proof of loss of income, reason for hardship, and verification of expenses. Four-Star Charity Navigator rating, 2025 Platinum Transparency status.

programs.application_process: Apply at usacares.org. Each family assigned an advocate from Family Resource Center. Payments made directly to mortgage lenders, utility companies, and vendors.

programs.program_name: GPS (Grants for Patriots and Supporters) Program
programs.max_amount_notes: Grants up to $1,000 for emergency financial needs; one grant per veteran per year

eligibility.summary: Disabled veterans with an honorable or general discharge who are experiencing a temporary financial hardship
eligibility.disability_notes: Must have a service-connected disability rating from the VA
eligibility.notes: Priority given to veterans facing imminent eviction, utility shutoff, or medical emergencies. Must demonstrate temporary hardship rather than chronic financial difficulty.

programs.application_process: Apply online at dvnf.org/gps or call the GPS hotline. Applications require DD214, VA disability rating letter, proof of financial need (past-due bills, eviction notice), and brief explanation of hardship. Funds disbursed directly to creditors.
